10.6084/m9.figshare.4497101.v2.title: Figure 3
10.6084/m9.figshare.4497101.v2.description: A phylogenetic tree produced with the Neighbor-joining method based on the 16S rRNA gene sequences of Legionella from river water samples. The numbers of the sequences in this tree refer to the numbers in the DGGE. The scale bar represents 200% of nucleotide sequence divergence. The numbers at the selected nodes indicate the levels of bootstrap support (percentage) based on 1000 re-sampled data sets (only values greater than 70% shown).

10.6084/M9.FIGSHARE.3404731.V3.title: BP Garage Ravenhill Roads, Belfast, Northern Ireland
10.6084/M9.FIGSHARE.3404731.V3.description: Image taken on Ravenhill Road Belfast as a trial of metada addition and use of searching tools. At the shop, also a fillling station a sign suggests that coal and oil are sold. The price of fuel (petrol/gas) is given in the image. The word interdenominational is seen on a building in the backgound. A person and a dog are visible as is a person (probably male) appears to be filling a blue car with petrol.

10.6084/m9.figshare.5236471.v1.title: Delta Method Downscaling, Version 1.0
10.6084/m9.figshare.5236471.v1.description: The source stored here represent the routines to a apply the statistical downscaling approach called Delta Method. We use this R and ArcInfo Macro Language (AML) scripts backing to develop a high resolution global database available at CCAFS-Climate portal (www.ccafs-climate.org) on future climate change scenarios. The data can be used for crop modeling, niche modeling, and more generally, for assessing impacts of climate change on agriculture at fine scales. The method requires monthly maximum, minimum, mean temperatures and monthly total precipitation (from which a set of bioclimatic indices were also derived). This database (with a total of 436 different scenarios, sum of 26, 31, 19 and 33 GCMs, times 4 time-slices, at 30 arc-seconds spatial resolution) complements other existing databases that also use downscaling but are only available either for a limited set of GCMs, time-slices, regions, or for variables or at coarser resolution. The CGIAR Research Program on Climate Change, Agriculture and Food Security (CCAFS) provides these data without any warranty of any kind whatsoever, either express or implied, including warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. CCAFS shall not be liable for incidental, consequential, or special damages arising out of the use of any data published here. CCAFS and its partners have processed this data to provide seamless continuous future climate surfaces. Users are prohibited from any commercial, non-free resale, or redistribution without explicit written permission from CCAFS or the data-developing institutions. Users should acknowledge CCAFS as the source used in the creation of any reports, publications, new data sets, derived products, or services resulting from the use of this data set.
